pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [057c7bfc3c](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15073/commits/057c7bfc3c99fb3dd82bab5b3c5c061b7eaceed6)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.RingHom.FinitePresentation`|1354|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ finitePresentation_holdsForLocalizationAway`
`+ finitePresentation_isLocal`
`+ finitePresentation_localizationPreserves`
`+ finitePresentation_ofLocalizationSpanTarget`
`+ finitePresentation_ofLocalizationSpanTarget_aux`
`+ finitePresentation_respectsIso`
`+ finitePresentation_stableUnderBaseChange`
`+ finitePresentation_stableUnderComposition`
`+ instance : IsScalarTower R (MvPolynomial Ïƒ R) (MvPolynomial Ïƒ S)`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.

:v: chrisflav can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10074383031/job/27850377791)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10074383031/job/27850377552)

Can you prove more generally that `S` is an `R`-algebra then `IsScalarTower R S (MvPolynomial Ïƒ S)`? Since `MvPolynomial.algebraMvPolynomial` is not an instance this cannot be an instance either, but can be a theorem (you can keep this instance of course).
Sorry you're right, something confused me. Thanks!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory): being finitely-presented is local
